1 /**
  2  * Emily
  3  * Copyright(c) 2012 Olivier Scherrer <pode.fr@gmail.com>
  4  * MIT Licensed
  5  */
  6 
  7 define("Tools",
  8 /**
  9  * @class
 10  * Tools is a collection of tools 
 11  */
 12 function Tools(){
 13 
 14 	return {
 15 	    /**
 16 	     * For applications that don't run in a browser, window is not the global object.
 17 	     * This function returns the global object wherever the application runs.
 18 	     * @returns {Object} the global object
 19 	     */
 20 		getGlobal: function getGlobal() {
 21 	    	var func = function() {
 22 	    		return this;
 23 	    	};
 24 	    	return func.call(null);
 25 	    },
 26 		
 27 		/**
 28 		 * Mixes an object into another
 29 		 * @param {Object} destination object to mix values into
 30 		 * @param {Object} source object to get values from
 31 		 * @param {Boolean} optional, set to true to prevent overriding
 32 		 */
 33 	    mixin: function mixin(source, destination, dontOverride) {
 34 			this.loop(source, function (value, idx) {
 35 				if (!destination[idx] || !dontOverride) {
 36 					destination[idx] = source[idx];	
 37 				}
 38 			});
 39 			return destination;
 40 		},
 41 		
 42 		/**
 43 		 * Count the number of properties in an object
 44 		 * It doesn't look up in the prototype chain
 45 		 * @param {Object} object the object to count
 46 		 * @returns {Number}
 47 		 */
 48 		count: function count(object) {
 49 			var nbItems = 0;
 50 			this.loop(object, function () {
 51 				nbItems++;
 52 			});
 53 			
 54 			return nbItems;
 55 		},
 56 		
 57 		/**
 58 		 * Compares the properties of two objects and returns true if they're the same
 59 		 * It's doesn't do it recursively
 60 		 * @param {Object} first object
 61 		 * @param {Object} second object
 62 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if the two objets have the same properties
 63 		 */
 64 		compareObjects: function compareObjects(object1, object2) {
 65 			var getOwnProperties = function (object) {
 66 				return Object.getOwnPropertyNames(object).sort().join("");
 67 			};
 68 			return getOwnProperties(object1) == getOwnProperties(object2);
 69 		},
 70 		
 71 		/**
 72 		 * Transform array-like objects to array, such as nodeLists or arguments
 73 		 * @param {Array-like object}
 74 		 * @returns {Array}
 75 		 */
 76 		toArray: function toArray(array) {
 77 			return Array.prototype.slice.call(array);
 78 		},
 79 		
 80 		/**
 81 		 * Small adapter for looping over objects and arrays
 82 		 * Warning: it's not meant to be used with nodeList
 83 		 * @param {Array/Object} iterated the array or object to loop through
 84 		 * @param {Function} callback the function to execute for each iteration
 85 		 * @param {Object} scope the scope in which to execute the callback
 86 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if executed
 87 		 */
 88 		loop: function loop(iterated, callback, scope) {
 89 			var i, 
 90 				length;
 91 			
 92 			if (iterated instanceof Object && typeof callback == "function") {
 93 				length = iterated.length;
 94 				if (length) {
 95 					for (i=0; i<length; i++) {
 96 						callback.call(scope, iterated[i], i, iterated);
 97 					}
 98 				} else {
 99 					for (i in iterated) {
100 						if (iterated.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
101 							callback.call(scope, iterated[i], i, iterated);
102 						}
103 					}
104 				}
105 				return true;
106 			} else {
107 				return false;
108 			}
109 		},
110 		
111 		/**
112 		 * Make a diff between two objects
113 		 * @param {Array/Object} before is the object as it was before
114 		 * @param {Array/Object} after is what it is now
115 		 * @example: 
116 		 * 	With objects:
117 		 * 
118 		 * 	before = {a:1, b:2, c:3, d:4, f:6}
119 		 * 	after = {a:1, b:20, d: 4, e: 5}
120 		 * 	will return : 
121 		 * 	{
122 		 *  	unchanged: ["a", "d"],
123 		 *  	updated: ["b"],
124 		 *  	deleted: ["f"],
125 		 *  	added: ["e"]
126 		 * 	}
127 		 * 
128 		 * It also works with Arrays:
129 		 * 
130 		 * 	before = [10, 20, 30]
131 		 * 	after = [15, 20]
132 		 * 	will return : 
133 		 * 	{
134 		 *  	unchanged: [1],
135 		 *  	updated: [0],
136 		 *  	deleted: [2],
137 		 *  	added: []
138 		 * 	}
139 		 * 
140 		 * @returns object
141 		 */
142 		objectsDiffs : function objectsDiffs(before, after) {
143 			if (before instanceof Object && after instanceof Object) {
144 				var unchanged = [],
145 					updated = [],
146 					deleted = [],
147 					added = [];
148 				
149 				 // Look through the after object
150 				 this.loop(after, function (value, idx) {
151 					 
152 					 // To get the updated
153 					 if (value !== before[idx] && typeof before[idx] != "undefined") {
154 						 updated.push(idx);
155 						 
156 					 // The unchanged	 
157 					 } else if (value === before[idx]) {
158 						 unchanged.push(idx);
159 					
160 					 // And the added
161 					 } else if (typeof before[idx] == "undefined") {
162 						 added.push(idx);
163 					 }
164 				 });
165 				 
166 				 // Loop through the before object
167 				 this.loop(before, function (value, idx) {
168 					 
169 					// To get the deleted 
170 					if (typeof after[idx] == "undefined") {
171 						deleted.push(idx);
172 					} 
173 				 });
174 				 
175 				return {
176 					updated: updated,
177 					unchanged: unchanged,
178 					added: added,
179 					deleted: deleted
180 				};
181 				
182 			} else {
183 				return false;
184 			}
185 		},
186 		
187 		/**
188 		 * Transforms Arrays and Objects into valid JSON
189 		 * @param {Object/Array} object the object to JSONify 
190 		 * @returns the JSONified object or false if failed
191 		 */
192 		jsonify: function jsonify(object) {
193 			if (object instanceof Object) {
194 				return JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(object));	
195 			} else {
196 				return false;
197 			}
198 		},
199 		
200 		/**
201 		 * Clone an Array or an Object
202 		 * @param {Array/Object} object the object to clone
203 		 * @returns {Array/Object} the cloned object
204 		 */
205 		clone: function clone(object) {
206 			if (object instanceof Array) {
207 				return object.slice(0);
208 			} else if (typeof object == "object" && object !== null && !(object instanceof RegExp)) {
209 				return this.mixin(object, {});
210 			} else {
211 				return object;
212 			}
213 		},
214 		
215 		
216 		/**
217 		 * 
218 		 * 
219 		 * 
220 		 * 
221 		 * Refactoring needed for the following 
222 		 * 
223 		 * 
224 		 * 
225 		 * 
226 		 * 
227 		 */
228 		
229 		/**
230 		 * Get the property of an object nested in one or more objects
231 		 * given an object such as a.b.c.d = 5, getObject(a, "b.c.d") will return 5.
232 		 * @param {Object} object the object to get the property from
233 		 * @param {String} property the path to the property as a string
234 		 * @returns the object or the the property value if found
235 		 */
236 		getNestedProperty: function getNestedProperty(object, property) {
237 			if (object && object instanceof Object) {
238 				if (typeof property == "string" && property != "") {
239 					var split = property.split(".");
240 					split.unshift(object);
241 					return split.reduce(function (obj, prop) {
242 						return obj[prop];
243 					});
244 				} else if (typeof property == "number") {
245 					return object[property];
246 				} else {
247 					return object;
248 				}
249 			} else {
250 				return object;
251 			}
252 		},
253 		
254 		/**
255 		 * Set the property of an object nested in oen or more objects
256 		 * @param {Object} object
257 		 * @param {String} property
258 		 * @param value the value to set
259 		 * @returns object if no assignment was made or the value if the assignment was made
260 		 */
261 		setNestedProperty: function setNestedProperty(object, property, value) {
262 			if (object && object instanceof Object) {
263 				if (typeof property == "string" && property != "") {
264 					var split = property.split(".");
265 					split.unshift(object);
266 					return split.reduce(function (obj, prop, idx) {
267 						if (split.length == (idx + 1)) {
268 							obj[prop] = value;
269 						}
270 						return obj[prop];
271 					});
272 				} else if (typeof property == "number") {
273 					object[property] = value;
274 					return object[property];
275 				} else {
276 					return object;
277 				}
278 			} else {
279 				return object;
280 			}
281 		}
282 		
283 		
284 		
285 	};
286 	
287 	
288 });
289
